title: Definition of Conditional Probability
text: The conditional probability of A given B is written as P(A|B). P(A|B) is the probability that the event A occurs given that the event B has already occurred. We note that the formula is $$P(A|B)=(P(A$$ AND B))/(P(B)).

title: Remembering P(A AND B)
text: What is P(A AND B), which you solved for above?

title: Determining P(A|B)
text: What is P(A|B), or in other words, P(A AND B) divided by P(B)?
